intro: Lepidagathis lindaviana, commonly known as the Lindaviana lily, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Iridaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow and orange. The plant has strap-like leaves and produces tall, slender stems that support its vibrant inflorescences. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded to semi-shaded habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections for its unique floral display.
